meanings.definition: The central part of an atom, consisting of protons and neutrons.
meanings.sent1: The nucleuses of atoms hold the protons and neutrons together.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the nucleuses of atoms to understand their structure.
meanings.sent3: The protons and neutrons in the nucleuses of atoms like to stick together.
meanings.sent4: In the world of atoms, the nucleuses are like the heart of the tiny universe.
meanings.sent5: The nucleuses of atoms are like the command center, controlling everything within.

meanings.definition: The central part of a cell, containing genetic material.
meanings.sent1: The nucleuses in cells store the genetic material that makes us unique.
meanings.sent2: Biologists study the nucleuses of cells to learn about DNA.
meanings.sent3: The nucleuses in cells are like tiny libraries full of genetic information.
meanings.sent4: The nucleuses of cells are the treasure chests of our genetic code.
meanings.sent5: Within the nucleuses of cells lies the blueprint of life itself.

meanings.definition: The central or most important part of something.
meanings.sent1: In a story, the nucleuses is often the climax where everything comes together.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the nucleuses of a problem can lead to finding the solution.
meanings.sent3: The nucleuses of a good joke is the punchline that makes everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The nucleuses of a team is the strong bond that holds everyone together.
meanings.sent5: Identifying the nucleuses of a project can help prioritize tasks effectively.
